parameters.Failure: 1: No specified reason for the local video failure.

parameters.DeviceNoPermission: 2: No permission to use the local video capturing device.

parameters.DeviceBusy: 3: The local video capturing device is in use.

parameters.CaptureFailure: 4: The local video capture fails. Check whether the capturing device is working properly.

parameters.CaptureInBackground: 6: The local video capturing device not available due to app did enter background.

parameters.CaptureMultipleForegroundApps: 7: The local video capturing device not available because the app is running in a multi-app layout (generally on the pad).

parameters.DeviceNotFound: 8: Fails to find a local video capture device.

parameters.LocalVideoStreamErrorDeviceInvalidId: 10: (macOS and Windows only) The SDK cannot find the video device in the video device list. Check whether the ID of the video device is valid.

parameters.ScreenCaptureWindowMinmized: startScreenCaptureByWindowId11: When calling to share the window, the shared window is in a minimized state.

parameters.ScreenCaptureWindowClosed:
12: The error code indicates that a window shared by the window ID has been closed, or a full-screen window shared by the window ID has exited full-screen mode. After exiting full-screen mode, remote users cannot see the shared window. To prevent remote users from seeing a black screen, Agora recommends that you immediately stop screen sharing.
      Common scenarios for reporting this error code:
 When the local user closes the shared window, the SDK reports this error code.
     The local user shows some slides in full-screen mode first, and then shares the windows of the slides. After the user exits full-screen mode, the SDK reports this error code.
     The local user watches web video or reads web document in full-screen mode first, and then shares the window of the web video or document. After the user exits full-screen mode, the SDK reports this error code.

parameters.LocalVideoStreamErrorScreenCaptureWindow: 13: (Windows only) The window being shared is overlapped by another window, so the overlapped area is blacked out by the SDK during window sharing.
20: (Windows only) The SDK does not support sharing this type of window.
